Version.description: The version of the Amazon States Language used in the state machine.

TimeoutSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds an execution of the state machine can run. If it runs longer than the specified time, the execution fails with a States.Timeout error.

StartAt.description: A string that must exactly match (is case sensitive) the name of a state.

States.description: An object containing a comma-delimited set of states.

oneOf.description: A Pass state passes its input to its output, without performing work. Pass states are useful when constructing and debugging state machines.

InputPath.description: A path that selects a portion of the state's input to be passed to the state's task for processing. If omitted, it has the value $ which designates the entire input.

ResultPath.description: A path that specifies where to place the Result, relative to the raw input. If the raw input has a field at the location addressed by the ResultPath value then in the output that field is discarded and overwritten by the state's result. Otherwise, a new field is created in the state output, with intervening fields constructed as necessary.

OutputPath.description: A path that selects a portion of the state's input to be passed to the state's output. If omitted, it has the value $ which designates the entire input.

Next.description: The name of the next state that is run when the current state finishes.

End.description: Designates this state as a terminal state (ends the execution) if set to true. There can be any number of terminal states per state machine.

Parameters.description: Used to pass information to the API actions of connected resources. The Parameters can use a mix of static JSON, JsonPath and intrinsic functions.

Output.description: A value to define the Output configuration of this task state.

oneOf.description: A Succeed state stops an execution successfully. The Succeed state is a useful target for Choice state branches that don't do anything but stop the execution.

InputPath.description: A path that selects a portion of the state's input to be passed to the state's task for processing. If omitted, it has the value $ which designates the entire input.

OutputPath.description: A path that selects a portion of the state's input to be passed to the state's output. If omitted, it has the value $ which designates the entire input.

oneOf.description: A Fail state stops the execution of the state machine and marks it as a failure.

Error.description: Provides an error name that can be used for error handling (Retry/Catch), operational, or diagnostic purposes.

Cause.description: Provides a custom failure string that can be used for operational or diagnostic purposes.

ErrorPath.description: Provides an error name that can be used for error handling (Retry/Catch), operational, or diagnostic purposes. Specified with JsonPath syntax or with Intrinsic Functions. The resulting value must be a string.

CausePath.description: Provides a custom failure string that can be used for operational or diagnostic purposes. Specified with JsonPath syntax or with Intrinsic Functions. The resulting value must be a string.

oneOf.description:
A Task state represents a single unit of work performed by a state machine.
All work in your state machine is done by tasks. A task performs work identified by the stateâ€™s Resource field, which is often an AWS Lambda function or other Step Functions service integrations.

Resource.description: A URI, especially an ARN that uniquely identifies the specific task to execute.

Parameters.description: Used to pass information to the API actions of connected resources. The Parameters can use a mix of static JSON, JsonPath and intrinsic functions.

ResultSelector.description: Used to transform the result. The ResultSelector can use a mix of static JSON, JsonPath and intrinsic functions.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

TimeoutSeconds.description: If the task runs longer than the specified seconds, this state fails with a States.Timeout error name. Must be a positive, non-zero integer, or a jsonata expression. If not provided, the default value is 99999999. The count begins after the task has been started, for example, when ActivityStarted or LambdaFunctionStarted are logged in the Execution event history.

TimeoutSecondsPath.description: If the task runs longer than the specified seconds, this state fails with a States.Timeout error. Specified using JsonPath syntax, to select the value from the state's input data.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

HeartbeatSeconds.description: If more time than the specified seconds elapses between heartbeats from the task, this state fails with a States.Timeout error name. Must be a positive, non-zero integer less than the number of seconds specified in the TimeoutSeconds field, or a jsonata expression. If not provided, the default value is 99999999. For Activities, the count begins when GetActivityTask receives a token and ActivityStarted is logged in the Execution event history.

HeartbeatSecondsPath.description: If more time than the specified seconds elapses between heartbeats from the task, this state fails with a States.Timeout error. Specified using JsonPath syntax, to select the value from the state's input data.

Retry.description: An array of objects, called Retriers, that define a retry policy if the state encounters runtime errors.

ErrorEquals.description: A non-empty array of Error Names. The retry policy for this Retrier is implemented if the reported error matches one of the Error Names.

IntervalSeconds.description: A positive integer representing the number of seconds before the first retry attempt. (Default: 1, Maximum: 99999999)

MaxAttempts.description: A non-negative integer representing the maximum number of retry attempts. (Default: 3, Maximum: 99999999)

BackoffRate.description: A number (>= 1) which is the multiplier that increases the retry interval on each attempt. (Default: 2.0)

MaxDelaySeconds.description: A positive integer representing the maximum number of seconds to wait before a retry attempt. If not specified, the limit is the maximum duration a state machine can run. (Maximum: 31622400)

JitterStrategy.description: The Jitter Strategy to apply to the retry interval.

Catch.description: An array of objects, called Catchers, that define a fallback state. This state is executed if the state encounters runtime errors and its retry policy is exhausted or isn't defined.

ErrorEquals.description: A non-empty array of Error Names. The state machine transitions to this Catcher's fallback state if the reported error matches one of the Error Names.

Next.description: The state to transition to on Error Name match.

oneOf.description: A path that specifies where to place the Result, relative to the raw input. If the raw input has a field at the location addressed by the ResultPath value then in the output that field is discarded and overwritten by the state's result. Otherwise, a new field is created in the state output, with intervening fields constructed as necessary.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of object, JSONata expression.

Arguments.description: An object or JSONata expression to define the Argument of this task state.

Assign.description: An object to define the variables to be assigned.

oneOf.description: A Choice state adds branching logic to a state machine.

Choices.description: An array of Choice Rules that determines which state the state machine transitions to next.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a valid choice state condition.
Incorrect type. Expected one of boolean, JSONata expression.

Next.description: The state to transition to if there is an exact match between the input value and the comparison operator for this Choice Rule.

Variable.description: A reference path specifying the input value to apply the comparison operator to.

Default.description: The name of the state to transition to if none of the Choice Rules match.

Assign.description: An object to define the variables to be assigned.

oneOf.description: A Wait state delays the state machine from continuing for a specified time. You can choose either a relative time, specified in seconds from when the state begins, or an absolute end time, specified as a timestamp.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

Seconds.description: A time, in seconds, to wait before beginning the state specified in the "Next" field.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of timestamp, JSONata expression.

Timestamp.description:
An absolute time to wait until beginning the state specified in the "Next" field.

Timestamps must conform to the RFC3339 profile of ISO 8601, with the further restrictions that an uppercase T must separate the date and time portions, and an uppercase Z must denote that a numeric time zone offset is not present, for example, 2016-08-18T17:33:00Z.

SecondsPath.description: A time, in seconds, to wait before beginning the state specified in the "Next" field, specified using a path from the state's input data.

TimestampPath.description: An absolute time to wait until beginning the state specified in the "Next" field, specified using a path from the state's input data.

oneOf.description: The Parallel state can be used to create parallel branches of execution in your state machine.

Parameters.description: Used to pass information to the API actions of connected resources. The Parameters can use a mix of static JSON, JsonPath and intrinsic functions.

ResultSelector.description: Used to transform the result. The ResultSelector can use a mix of static JSON, JsonPath and intrinsic functions.

Branches.description: An array of objects that specifies state machines to execute in parallel.

StartAt.description: A string that must exactly match (is case sensitive) the name of one of the state objects.

Retry.description: Contains an array of objects, called Retriers, that define a retry policy if the state encounters runtime errors.

Catch.description: Contains an array of objects, called Catchers, that define a fallback state. This state is executed if the state encounters runtime errors and its retry policy is exhausted or isn't defined.

oneOf.description: The Map state can be used to run a set of steps for each element of an input array. While the Parallel state executes multiple branches of steps using the same input, a Map state will execute the same steps for multiple entries of an array in the state input.

Parameters.description: Used to pass information to the API actions of connected resources. The Parameters can use a mix of static JSON, JsonPath and intrinsic functions.

ResultSelector.description: Used to transform the result. The ResultSelector can use a mix of static JSON, JsonPath and intrinsic functions.

ItemsPath.description: Reference path identifying where in the effective input the array field is found.

Iterator.description: A state machine which will process each element of the array.

StartAt.description: A string that must exactly match (is case sensitive) the name of one of the state objects.

ItemReader.description: Specifies the location of the dataset from which the Map state reads its input data.

ReaderConfig.description: A JSON object that specifies where to read the items instead of from the effective input.

InputType.description: A string that specifies the type of Amazon S3 data source.

CSVHeaderLocation.description: A string that specifies the location of the CSV column header.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

MaxItems.description: An integer or JSONata expression that limits the number of data items passed to the Map state.

MaxItemsPath.description: A reference path to an integer that limits the number of data items passed to the Map state.

CSVDelimiter.description: A string that specifies the delimiter used to separate values in the CSV file.

Resource.description: The Amazon S3 API action Step Functions must invoke depending on the specified dataset.

Arguments.description: A JSON object or JSONata expression that specifies the Amazon S3 bucket name and object key or prefix in which the dataset is stored.

Bucket.description: A string that specifies the Amazon S3 bucket name in which the dataset is stored.

Key.description: A string that specifies Amazon S3 object key in which the dataset is stored.

Parameters.description: A JSON object that specifies the Amazon S3 bucket name and object key or prefix in which the dataset is stored.

Bucket.description: A string that specifies the Amazon S3 bucket name in which the dataset is stored.

Key.description: A string that specifies Amazon S3 object key in which the dataset is stored.

ItemSelector.description: A JSON object or value that overrides each single element of the item array.

ItemBatcher.description: A JSON object that specifies how to batch the items for the ItemProcessor.

BatchInput.description: Specifies a fixed JSON input to include in each batch passed to each child workflow execution.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

MaxItemsPerBatch.description: An integer or JSONata expression that limits the maximum number of items of each sub-array.

MaxItemsPerBatchPath.description: A reference path to an integer that limits the maximum number of items of each sub-array.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

MaxInputBytesPerBatch.description: An integer or JSONata expression that limits the maximum size in bytes of each sub-array.

MaxInputBytesPerBatchPath.description: A reference path to an integer that limits the maximum size in bytes of each sub-array.

ResultWriter.description: A JSON object that specifies where to write the results instead of to the Map state's result.

Resource.description: A string that specifies the Amazon S3 API action Step Functions must invoke depending on the specified dataset.

Arguments.description: A JSON object that specifies the Amazon S3 resource to export the results to.

Bucket.description: A string that specifies the Amazon S3 bucket name to export the results to.

Prefix.description: A string that specifies the Amazon S3 object prefix to export the results to.

Parameters.description: A JSON object that specifies the Amazon S3 resource to export the results to.

Bucket.description: A string that specifies the Amazon S3 bucket name to export the results to.

Prefix.description: A string that specifies the Amazon S3 object prefix to export the results to.

WriterConfig.description: A JSON object that specifies the configuration for the results of the map.

OutputType.description: A string that specifies the type in which Map state results are formatted.

Transformation.description: A string that specifies how the Map state results transformed before returning.

ItemProcessor.description: A JSON object that defines a state machine which will process each item or batch of items of the array.

ProcessorConfig.description: A JSON object that specifies the Map state processing mode and definition.

ExecutionType.description: The execution type for the Map workflow.

StartAt.description: A string that must exactly match (is case sensitive) the name of one of the state objects.

Label.description: A string that uniquely identifies a Map state.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

ToleratedFailurePercentage.description: An integer or JSONata expression that provides an upper bound on the percentage of items that may fail.

ToleratedFailurePercentagePath.description: A reference path to an integer that provides an upper bound on the percentage of items that may fail.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

ToleratedFailureCount.description: An integer or JSONata expression that provides an upper bound on how many items may fail.

ToleratedFailureCountPath.description: A reference path to an integer that provides an upper bound on how many items may fail.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of integer, JSONata expression.

MaxConcurrency.description:
Provides an upper bound on how many invocations of the Iterator may run in parallel.

The default value is 0, which places no limit on parallelism and iterations are invoked as concurrently as possible.

MaxConcurrencyPath.description: A reference path to an integer that provides an upper bound on how many invocations of the Iterator may run in parallel.

Retry.description: Contains an array of objects, called Retriers, that define a retry policy if the state encounters runtime errors.

Catch.description: Contains an array of objects, called Catchers, that define a fallback state. This state is executed if the state encounters runtime errors and its retry policy is exhausted or isn't defined.

oneOf.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected one of array, JSONata expression.

Items.description: An array or JSONata expression identifying where in the state input the array field is found.

QueryLanguage.description: ASL mode configuration. Specify either JSONata or JSONPath.
